clinical_study.brief_title: Regulation of Emotions and Coping Behaviour in Patients With Chronic Recurrent Low Back Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Emotionsregulation Und Bewältigungsverhalten in Zusammenhang Mit Ambulanter Rehabilitation Oder Physikalischer Therapie Bei Chronischem Rückenschmerz

lead_sponsor.agency: Karl Landsteiner Institute of Remobilization and Functional Health

clinical_study.source: Karl Landsteiner Institute of Remobilization and Functional Health

brief_summary.textblock:
This study investigates effects of a multidisciplinary rehabilitation program or physical therapy in patients with chronic low back pain on emotion regulation and coping behaviour.
Hypothesis: Significant differences of negative emotions pre and post treatment and between groups after intervention.
Standardised questionnaires are used for investigation

detailed_description.textblock: Emotionsregulations-Inventar ERI Emotion Regulation Questionnaire ERQ Positive and Negative Affect Schedule PANAS Brief Symptom Inventory BSI-18

clinical_study.why_stopped: recruitment problems in the controle group

primary_outcome.measure: Emotion regulation before and after treatment
primary_outcome.description: Emotion regulation will be assessed with the questionnaire Emotionsregulations-Inventar ERI

secondary_outcome.measure: Isometric muscle strenght before and after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The maximum voluntary isometric muscle strength of the lumbar extensor muscles will be assessed

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain in the spine before and after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Pain will be assessed with Visual Analogue Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotion regulation before and after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Emotion regulation will be assessed with the Emotion Regulation Questionnaire ERQ

arm_group.description: whole-body resistance training, psychological interventions, sessions for information related to ergonomics and healthy alimentation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- chronic low back pain > 3 months
- VAS >= 2
- understanding of german language
Exclusion Criteria:
- retired
- psychiatric disorders
- dementia
- sick headache
- chronic pain disease other than chronic low back pain
- patients with general contraindications of the therapy
